post_text: I am so proud of the Henry Sibley Class of 2020 and can't wait to celebrate virtually with them on Sunday, May 31! Make sure to tune in this Sunday at 5 p.m. on Town Square Television or Henry Sibley High School to watch. #WarriorStrong #WarriorPride

May 26 at 3:45 PM ¬∑

post_text: I would like to congratulate the six Henry Sibley High School Band members who have been named to this year's Minnesota All-State Honor Bands. Their countless hours of practicing, perfecting, and performing have paid off. Congratulations to Nick, Lily, Gena, Gavin, Bella, and Quinn! #WarriorPride #WarriorStrong
shared_text:
Henry Sibley High School
May 20 at 8:00 PM ¬∑

Congratulations to these Henry Sibley High School band participants for being selected for All-State! In her message to the students, Henry Sibley Director of Bands Amy Powers wrote, "This is the highest possible achievement in our state for a high school musician. Being named to All-State is a reflection of your incredible devotion and commitment to your craft. ...Your lesson teachers and I are so VERY proud of you and we are so happy for you." #warriorpride

post_text: Heritage Environmental-STEM Middle School's Virtual Groundbreaking event marks the final groundbreaking ceremony for School District 197. I am grateful to have had the opportunity to share the excitement and anticipation that comes with each of our schools construction updates and improvements. I also want to say THANK YOU to our community members for making these improvements possible. #OurCommunity #OurFuture
shared_text:

post_text: Today, I want to shine a bright spotlight on the dedication and hard work of School District 197‚Äôs teaching staff. For a profession that thrives on the personal connections forged between teachers and their students, I continue to be amazed and inspired by the ability of our teachers to continue to nurture those connections, deliver high-quality learning experiences, and support the social-emotional needs of their students from a distance.

Somerset Elementary School
May 1 at 3:19 PM ¬∑

In honor of May Day, staff members delivered a special message to our families! Here is what the message said:

"Happy May Day. We miss you so much. Each night we all wish upon a star knowing that our students are all growing into stronger, brighter, and wiser Somerset stars! We wish you well!"

post_text: We are deeply grateful for those School District 197 staff members who are providing essential services so we can continue to meet the needs of our students. To all of them, I would like to say on behalf of our district and our community...THANK YOU!

post_text: February 17-21 is Minnesota's School Board Recognition Week. Thanks to the hard work of our Independent School District 197 School Board members, our students are preparing for a bright future. Join me in celebrating Joanne Mansur, Stephanie Levine, Byron Schwab, John Chandler, Brenda Corbett, Maureen Ramirez, and Terry Stamman. Thank a school board member today!

post_text: I'm not crying, you're crying...(yes, I am). A huge thank you to those who make great sacrifices to serve our country. Welcome home, Captain Shouler.
shared_text:
Independent School District 197
January 31 at 3:49 PM ¬∑

This morning, Air National Guard Captain Brent Shouler who serves in Unit 210, Engineering Installation Squadron, surprised his two children during class at Henry Sibley High School. He had just returned from overseas deployment and hadn't seen Nikolas Shouler and Madison SaintJean since this past August. Watch the video to see their reactions. Welcome back, Captain Shouler, and thank you for your service to our country!
text:
I'm not crying, you're crying...(yes, I am). A huge thank you to those who make great sacrifices to serve our country. Welcome home, Captain Shouler.

Independent School District 197
January 31 at 3:49 PM ¬∑

This morning, Air National Guard Captain Brent Shouler who serves in Unit 210, Engineering Installation Squadron, surprised his two children during class at Henry Sibley High School. He had just returned from overseas deployment and hadn't seen Nikolas Shouler and Madison SaintJean since this past August. Watch the video to see their reactions. Welcome back, Captain Shouler, and thank you for your service to our country!

post_text: This week is Paraprofessional Recognition Week in Minnesota! I would like to recognize and celebrate all of our paraprofessionals and the many roles they take on in our district. Your hard work and devotion to our students is an essential part of their educational success. Thank you! #warriorpride #gowarriors
shared_text:
Minnesota Department of Education
January 23 at 1:48 PM ¬∑

üö® Governor Tim Walz has proclaimed next week, (Jan 27-31) as Paraprofessionals Recognition Week.

There are over 20,000 paraprofessionals in Minnesota working hard every day to make sure every child has the education they need to succeed in school and life. Join us in thanking them!

post_text: In recognition of their service to students in extracurricular activities, School District 197 is joining Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, the Minnesota State High School League, the Minnesota Interscholastic Activities Administrators Association, the Minnesota State High School Coaches Association, and school districts across the state that are recognizing ‚ÄúThank a Coach/Advisor Week‚Äù from January 27 through February 2. I would like to honor and support the coaches and advisors throughout our school district that make an integral, positive, and lifelong impact on our students. Thank you!

post_text: What‚Äôs better than being the state grand champion? Repeating it. For the second year in a row, the Henry Sibley marching band was named the grand champion in Alexandria this past weekend, which is the state championship for parade marching. Congrats to all the musicians, directors and supporters. You make us all proud. This is an incredibly dedicated group of people who absolutely love what they do (and so do the judges üòâ). @School District 197

post_text: Congratulations to Allie Prokosch for winning the Region 3AA Triple A Award for Athletics, Academics, and Arts. Each year, only two students (one male and one female) across all the districts in our region win this award. Allie is a great example of a well rounded and successful District 197 student who is taking advantage of the many opportunities that Sibley High School has to offer.

post_text:
October is National Principals Month! Please join me in thanking our school principals for their hard work and dedication to kids. As a former principal, I can tell you that it is not an easy job. Principals support students, lead and coach staff, engage with families and you will even see many of them pitching in for a shift on the bus or lunchroom duty. Thank you to all of the principals, associate principals and deans in Independent School District 197 for all you do! #ThankAPrincipal

By the way, in honor of this special month, Governor Mark Dayton proclaimed Oct. 15-21 Principals Week in Minnesota. Read the full proclamation at https://mn.gov/governor/assets/2018_10_15_10_21_Minnesota%20Principals%20Week_tcm1055-354857.pdf

Our Centers for Advanced Professional Studies (CAPS) programs are launching! Our Henry Sibley High School students will be gaining real career experiences and deep insights into the transportation and health care industries, with more on the way. A big thank you to all of our business partners and our hosts Twin Cities Orthopedics and North American Trailer.
www.careercollegeready.org

post_text: Our community approved a plan to improve our buildings. Thank you! Do you want to see some exciting designs for how they might look? Then you should put September 20 from 6:00 to 7:30 on your calendar at Henry Sibley High School. Come see what over 150 community and staff members have been collaboratively creating this summer. You will have the chance to learn about the planning process, see preliminary architectural drawings, ask questions and more. The event is an open house. Come anytime between 6 and 7:30 p.m. You can also learn about the progress that has been made by visiting www.isd197.org/news/facilities
text:
Our community approved a plan to improve our buildings. Thank you! Do you want to see some exciting designs for how they might look? Then you should put September 20 from 6:00 to 7:30 on your calendar at Henry Sibley High School. Come see what over 150 community and staff members have been collaboratively creating this summer. You will have the chance to learn about the planning process, see preliminary architectural drawings, ask questions and more. The event is an open house. Come anytime between 6 and 7:30 p.m. You can also learn about the progress that has been made by visiting www.isd197.org/news/facilities

ISD197.ORG
www.isd197.org

post_text: School nurses and health paraprofessionals in District 197 work each day to support the educational process by promoting, improving and protecting the health of our students. Their work is key to the overall success of our children, whether it‚Äôs administering medication, checking a sore throat, comforting a child who does not feel well, performing a health screening, monitoring a food allergy and beyond. Today, on National School Nurses Day, I‚Äôd like to share how much we appreciate the nurses and health paraprofessionals in District 197. Thank you for all you do!

post_text: In darkness and daylight, from warm spring days to frigid winters, our school bus drivers and monitors safely transport students to and from school, activities and field trips throughout the year. They are often the first and last district staff members a student sees each day. Today is School Bus Driver Appreciation Day in Minnesota and I want to recognize the outstanding transportation staff in Independent School District 197 for all that they do to transport our community‚Äôs most precious cargo, our kids. Thank you!

post_text:
This week Independent School District 197 joins with other districts across the state to honor our school board for their commitment to students. Being a board member is a demanding job. Our board members spend countless hours preparing for and participating in meetings, studying education issues, advocating for our schools and communicating with parents and teachers. On behalf of our community, thank you for your service!

Minnesota School Boards Association

This week Independent School District 197 joins with other districts across the state to honor our school board for their commitment to students. Being a board member is a demanding job. Our board members spend countless hours preparing for and participating in meetings, studying education issues, advocating for our schools and communicating with parents and teachers. On behalf of our community, thank you for your service!

Minnesota School Boards Association
